conbody.p: A picture is an object which can be drawn to a graphics context and can be stored and restored. A picture is stored, together with its picture header, in any type of store using a storemap.

fig.title: Relationship between picture headers and pictures in a store

conbody.p: A picture can thus be any object which draws an image â€” be it a bitmap or a set of graphic commands.
Additionally, two common desirable facilities for a picture to have are:
Scaling can be done in one of three ways:

li.p: by specifying percentage scale factors for the width and height
by specifying the picture size in pixels
by specifying the picture size in twips

conbody.p: Cropping can be done in two ways:

li.p: by specifying a set of margins in twips
by specifying a further set of margins in pixels, for additional cropping

conbody.p: The drawing operation positions and draws the scaled and cropped picture on the graphics device.
